document.full_text: a nato decision to take charge of a no-fly zone over libya does not include conducting air strikes against muammar gaddafi's ground forces, a mission that will remain in u.s. hands until a new command deal is reached, vice admiral bill gortney said on friday.
document.title: nato deal leaves u.s. still commanding libya strikes
lines_and_colors: a nato decision to take charge of a no-fly zone over libya does not include conducting air strikes against muammar gaddafi's ground forces, a mission that will remain in u.s. hands until a new command deal is reached, vice admiral bill gortney said on friday.
